On 10/24/06, Magnus <t703093@...> wrote:
>  Thanx, but I should then make a directory called mypackage to make
>  this work?
>  Is it important where I put the different files accrdinf to junit?

JUnit is just a library. JUnit doesn't care where you put your .class files.
Java cares. Or, to be more accurate, the compiler ("javac") and the
JVM ("java") care.

I'd seriously recommend reading a tutorial on Java's classpath. Here's
a couple that might help you out:

http://www.jarticles.com/package/package_eng.html

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/package/managingfiles.html


Lasse
